patterns.name: Badrinath Temple
patterns.quick_version: May-June peak, closes Nov-Apr, opening/closing weeks busiest.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: May-June busiest due to opening season. September post-monsoon rush. Opening/closing weeks overwhelming.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Don't visit opening week (late April/early May) or closing week (November) - most crowded with VIP ceremonies.

patterns.name: Jagannath Puri Temple
patterns.quick_version: Rath Yatra (June-July) insanely crowded, winter pleasant.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Rath Yatra overwhelming. Temple closed 7 days during festival - deities at Gundicha Temple.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: During Rath Yatra week, main temple closed. Plan for Gundicha Temple or avoid the week entirely.

patterns.name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
patterns.quick_version: Mondays and Shravan month massive crowds, Mahashivratri peak.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Mondays 70% more crowded. Shravan month overwhelming. New corridor improved flow but still intense.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Don't bring phones/electronics - strict security. Avoid Mondays if possible - any other weekday 70% better.

patterns.name: Tirupati Balaji Temple
patterns.quick_version: Always crowded, Rs 300 ticket saves 18-20 hours.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: World's most visited temple. Free darshan 18-24 hours. Rs 300 special entry 2-4 hours.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Free darshan is 18-24 hour wait. Budget Rs 300 special entry - saves entire day.

patterns.name: Kedarnath Temple
patterns.quick_version: Opening/closing weeks peak, helicopter books months ahead.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Open 6 months only. Registration limits daily entries. Helicopter expensive but time-saving.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Registration mandatory on official portal - many arrive without and can't trek. Helicopter tickets sell out months ahead.

patterns.name: Golden Temple
patterns.quick_version: Open 24/7, visit 3-5 AM for peace.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: 24-hour access helps distribute crowds. 3-5 AM magical and peaceful.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Don't visit only during day - 3-5 AM Amrit Vela when Guru Granth Sahib brought to sanctum is most spiritual.

patterns.name: Vaishno Devi Temple
patterns.quick_version: Navratri peaks, weekends double traffic.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: 8-10 million annual visitors. Navratri overwhelming. Helicopter weather-dependent.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Helicopter doesn't reach cave - only till Sanjichhat. 2.5 km walking mandatory.

patterns.name: Kamakhya Temple
patterns.quick_version: Ambubachi Mela (June) extreme, regular days manageable.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Ambubachi temple closed 3 days. Opens 4th day with maximum crowds.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Temple closed during Ambubachi for 3 days. Opens 4th day with maximum rush. Plan accordingly.

patterns.name: Meenakshi Amman Temple
patterns.quick_version: Fridays busiest, Chithirai Festival massive.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Fridays goddess's day - 3x crowds. Chithirai chariot procession massive.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Fridays 3x normal crowds. Visit Monday-Thursday for better experience.

patterns.name: Shirdi Sai Baba Temple
patterns.quick_version: Thursdays insanely crowded, avoid at all costs.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Thursdays busiest - 10+ hour waits. Any other weekday 70% less crowded.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Never visit Thursday. Monday-Wednesday equally auspicious with fraction of crowd.

patterns.name: Haridwar
patterns.quick_version: Kumbh years extreme, regular years manageable.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Kumbh years millions descend. Regular years manageable. Evening Aarti crowded but worth it.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Arrive 30 minutes early for Ganga Aarti to get viewing spot.

patterns.name: Rishikesh
patterns.quick_version: March Yoga Festival peak, off-season peaceful.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Yoga Festival global tourists. Rafting season (March-June, Sept-Nov) adventure crowds.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Beatles Ashram requires entry ticket and closes 6 PM. Many expect free entry.

patterns.name: Mathura-Vrindavan
patterns.quick_version: Holi week insane, Janmashtami midnight peak.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Holi week madness. Janmashtami midnight extremely crowded. Banke Bihari always has queues.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Banke Bihari darshan is 2-3 seconds - curtains drawn repeatedly. Don't expect long viewing.

patterns.name: Ayodhya Ram Mandir
patterns.quick_version: New temple always crowded, Ram Navami overwhelming.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: New temple (2024) massive crowds. Online booking mandatory. Infrastructure developing.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Online booking absolutely mandatory - no walk-ins. Book 2-3 weeks advance.

patterns.name: Pushkar
patterns.quick_version: Camel Fair (Oct-Nov) madness, book 4 months ahead.
festival_spikes: Pushkar Camel Fair and Kartik Purnima (overlap)
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Camel Fair 200,000+ people. Town population 20,000. Accommodations book 4-6 months ahead.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Camel Fair prices triple. Book accommodation months ahead or arrive without and sleep rough.

patterns.name: Trimbakeshwar Jyotirlinga
patterns.quick_version: Shravan Mondays peak, Kumbh years extreme.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Shravan Mondays 4-6 hour waits. Nashik Kumbh millions.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Narayan Nagbali ritual requires 3 days and advance priest booking. Can't be done spontaneously.

patterns.name: Tiruvannamalai
patterns.quick_version: Karthigai Deepam massive, Full Moon Girivalam crowded.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Karthigai Deepam massive lamp atop hill draws lakhs. Full moon Girivalam thousands.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Girivalam (14 km barefoot) never at noon in summer - dangerous heat. Early morning or evening only.

patterns.name: Kanchipuram
patterns.quick_version: Manageable crowds, temples close noon-4 PM.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Generally manageable. Multiple temples spread across city. Afternoon closure 12-4 PM.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Temples close 12-4 PM. Plan morning (6-12) or evening (4-8) visits. Many waste afternoon waiting.

patterns.name: Shani Shingnapur
patterns.quick_version: Saturdays insanely crowded, weekdays peaceful.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Saturdays 10x normal crowds. Weekdays peaceful. Open-air temple so space not issue but oil queue long.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Never visit Saturday. Monday-Friday equally auspicious, 90% less crowded.

patterns.name: Somnath Temple
patterns.quick_version: Shravan and Mahashivratri peaks.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: First Jyotirlinga significance. Shravan and Mahashivratri peaks. Sound-light show popular.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Sound-light show tickets sell out - book online or early. Show narrates incredible temple history.

patterns.name: Mahakaleshwar Ujjain
patterns.quick_version: Bhasma Aarti books 2-3 months ahead.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Bhasma Aarti 4 AM requires 2-3 month advance booking. Unique ritual.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Bhasma Aarti fills months ahead - book immediately. Without booking cannot attend.

patterns.name: Sabarimala Temple
patterns.quick_version: Mandalam-Makaravilakku season overwhelming.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Virtual queue mandatory. 41-day vratham preparation. Millions during season. Women restriction controversial.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: 41-day vratham not optional - required for darshan. Virtual queue booking essential.

patterns.name: Guruvayur Temple
patterns.quick_version: Ekadasi days peak, strict dress code enforced.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Strict dress code - dhoti mandatory for men. Ekadasi days peak.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Dress code extremely strict. Western clothes denied entry. Wear traditional.

patterns.name: Amarnath Cave
patterns.quick_version: 45-day window July-August only, registration mandatory.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: 45-day window only. Registration with medical certificate mandatory. Extreme weather and security.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Registration mandatory months ahead. Physical fitness crucial. Many underestimate challenge.

patterns.name: Bodh Gaya
patterns.quick_version: Buddha Purnima (Vesak) peak, winter pleasant.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Global Buddhist pilgrims. Buddha Purnima massive. Regular days peaceful meditation atmosphere.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Museum closed Fridays. Don't miss Ashoka pillar capital - national emblem.

patterns.name: Palitana Temples
patterns.quick_version: 3800 steps, start dawn, no food on hill.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: 3800 steps barefoot. Fitness essential. No food/overnight stay on hill. Life-changing but demanding.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: 3800 steps not easy - assess fitness honestly. No food on hill - eat before climbing.

patterns.name: Hampi Virupaksha
patterns.quick_version: UNESCO site, winter best, 2-3 days needed.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Active temple amid 500+ monuments. 2-3 days needed for full Hampi exploration.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Virupaksha is active temple - remove shoes respectfully. Many treat as only archaeological site.

patterns.name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
patterns.quick_version: Kali Puja night spectacular, Ramakrishna connection key.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Ramakrishna connection main attraction. Kali Puja night crowded but spectacular.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Main attraction is Ramakrishna's room - don't just visit temple. Absorb spiritual atmosphere.

patterns.name: Dwarka Temple
patterns.quick_version: Janmashtami peak, combine with Bet Dwarka island.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: Five daily aartis. Janmashtami overwhelming. Bet Dwarka island trip essential.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Bet Dwarka island visit essential - pilgrimage incomplete without it. Many skip due to time.

patterns.name: Rameshwaram Temple
patterns.quick_version: 22 theertham bath takes 2-3 hours, don't rush.
patterns.crowd_level_summary: 22 theertham bath tradition takes 2-3 hours. Don't rush - all 22 for complete merit.
patterns.avoid_common_mistake: Don't rush 22 theertham bath - takes 2-3 hours. Tradition requires all 22.
